There are a lot of troubling things going on with these activists finding willing audiences in corrupt politicians like Kathleen Wynne.  Just as they are trying to censor this brilliant and refreshing documentary on Dr. Zucker, (I'd encourage you to look into this heroic professional who was black listed by these career, taxpayer bleeding, social justice warriors and militant activists), they did the same thing with the Ontario Sex Ed curriculum.  They banned any parental feedback and deferred to the activist themselves to review it and approve it, despite the fact that it heavily promotes gender diasphora, and the fantasies of Ben Levin.

These totalitarians operate under the guise of gaining equality for a supposed marginalized group, but are willing to go scorched earth with your children to get what they want.  If you don't go along you're branded a homophobe or ignorant, but ask them for any scientific evidence and they'll trot out some junk science and personally attack you.

The following story was told by an American soldier who served in Iraq. His name is not given, but his story is a testament to the resilience of the human spirit.

During the early days of the Iraq War, this soldier was part of a team that was assigned to secure a small town in Iraq. One day, the team was called in to deal with an incident that had occurred in the town. A group of Iraqi soldiers had killed an American soldier, and the team was sent to investigate.

As they approached the town, they could see that the Iraqi soldiers had set up a roadblock and were armed with machine guns. The American soldiers quickly realized that they were outnumbered and outgunned. They knew that they had to find a way to get through the roadblock without being killed.

The soldier who told the story was the one who came up with the plan. He knew that the Iraqi soldiers were afraid of the American soldiers and that they would not want to fight them. So, he came up with a plan to trick the Iraqi soldiers into thinking that the American soldiers were not there to fight.

He told the other soldiers to put on their helmets and to stand in a line. Then, he told them to raise their guns and to aim at the Iraqi soldiers. The Iraqi soldiers were so scared that they immediately surrendered. The American soldiers were able to get through the roadblock without any shots being fired.

This soldier's story is a testament to the resilience of the human spirit. He was able to think on his feet and to come up with a plan that saved his fellow soldiers' lives. His story is a reminder of the bravery and courage of the American soldiers who served in Iraq.

Once upon a time, there was a young prince named Arthur who lived in a kingdom called Camelot. Arthur was the son of King Uther Pendragon and Lady Igraine. After his father's death, Arthur was crowned king of Camelot.

Arthur was a brave and just king, and his kingdom prospered under his rule. However, there was one thing that Arthur desired above all else: the legendary sword Excalibur.

One day, Arthur heard a story about a magical sword that was hidden in a lake. The sword was said to be so powerful that it could only be drawn by the true king of Camelot.

Arthur set out on a quest to find the sword. He traveled far and wide, but he could not find the lake where the sword was said to be hidden.

Finally, Arthur came to a small village on the outskirts of Camelot. There, he met an old woman who told him that the lake where the sword was hidden was nearby.

The old woman told Arthur that he must take a boat to the lake and then dive into the water to find the sword. She warned Arthur that the lake was guarded by a powerful monster, and that he must be careful.

Arthur thanked the old woman and set out for the lake. When he arrived, he saw that the lake was surrounded by a thick forest. He entered the forest and made his way to the lake.

When Arthur reached the lake, he saw that it was dark and eerie. He could see the outline of a monster lurking in the depths of the lake.

Arthur took a deep breath and dove into the water. He swam down to the bottom of the lake, where he saw the sword lying on a rock.

Arthur grabbed the sword and pulled it from the rock. As soon as he did, the monster emerged from the depths of the lake and attacked him.

Arthur fought the monster with all his strength, but he was no match for the creature. Just when it looked like Arthur was about to be defeated, the old woman appeared and helped him defeat the monster.

Arthur was grateful to the old woman for her help. He thanked her and then set out for Camelot with the sword.

When Arthur arrived in Camelot, he was hailed as a hero. He was crowned king of Camelot and the people celebrated his victory.

Arthur was a brave and just king, and his kingdom prospered under his rule. He ruled Camelot for many years, and the people were happy and prosperous.

They traveled far and wide, but they could not find the source of the storm. Finally, they came to a small village on the outskirts of Camelot. There, they met an old woman who told them that the storm was being caused by a powerful wizard.

The wizard was called Morgana, and she was a witch who lived in a tower on the outskirts of Camelot. She was angry with Arthur because he had taken her magic sword, Excalibur.

Arthur and his knights set out to find Morgana and stop her from causing the storm. They traveled to her tower and confronted her.

Morgana was angry and powerful, but Arthur and his knights were brave and determined. They fought Morgana and her magic, and they finally defeated her.

The storm stopped and the people of Camelot rejoiced. Arthur was hailed as a hero once again, and he ruled Camelot for many more years.

But then, one day, a dark cloud appeared in the sky and a terrible storm raged across the land. The people of Camelot were afraid, but Arthur was not.

Arthur knew that the storm was a sign of something bad to come. He gathered his knights and they set out to find the source of the storm.

They traveled far and wide, but they could not find the source of the storm. Finally, they came to a small village on the outskirts of Camelot. There, they met an old woman who told them that the storm was being caused by a powerful wizard.

The wizard was called Morgana, and she was a witch who lived in a tower on the outskirts of Camelot. She was angry with Arthur because he had taken her magic sword, Excalibur.

Arthur and his knights set out to find Morgana and stop her from causing the storm. They traveled to her tower and confronted her.

Morgana was angry and powerful, but Arthur and his knights were brave and determined. They fought Morgana and her magic, and they finally defeated her.

The storm stopped and the people of Camelot rejoiced. Arthur was hailed as a hero once again, and he ruled Camelot for many more years.

Once upon a time, there was a young prince named Arthur who lived in a kingdom called Camelot. Arthur was the son of King Uther Pendragon and Lady Igraine. After his father's death, Arthur was crowned king of Camelot.

Arthur was a brave and just king, and his kingdom prospered under his rule. However, there was one thing that Arthur desired above all else: the legendary sword Excalibur.

One day, Arthur heard a story about a magical sword that was hidden in a lake. The sword was said to be so powerful that it could only be drawn by the true king of Camelot.

Arthur set out on a quest to find the sword. He traveled far and wide, but he could not find the lake where the sword was said to be hidden.

Finally, Arthur came to a small village on the outskirts of Camelot. There, he met an old woman who told him that the lake where the sword was hidden was nearby.

The old woman told Arthur that he must take a boat to the lake and then dive into the water to find the sword. She warned Arthur that the lake was guarded by a powerful monster, and that he must be careful.

Arthur thanked the old woman and set out for the lake. When he arrived, he saw that the lake was dark and eerie. He could see the outline of a monster lurking in the depths of the lake.

Arthur took a deep breath and dove into the water. He swam down to the bottom of the lake, where he saw the sword lying on a rock.

Arthur grabbed the sword and pulled it from the rock. As soon as he did, the monster emerged from the depths of the lake and attacked him.

Arthur fought the monster with all his strength, but he was no match for the creature. Just when it looked like Arthur was about to be defeated, the old woman appeared and helped him defeat the monster.

Arthur was grateful to the old woman for her help. He thanked her and then set out for Camelot with the sword.

Once upon a time, there was a young prince named Arthur who lived in a kingdom called Camelot. Arthur was the son of King Uther Pendragon and Lady Igraine. After his father's death, Arthur was crowned king of Camelot.

Arthur was a brave and just king, and his kingdom prospered under his rule. However, there was one thing that Arthur desired above all else: the legendary sword Excalibur.

One day, Arthur heard a story about a magical sword that was hidden in a lake. The sword was said to be so powerful that it could only be drawn by the true king of Camelot.

Arthur set out on a quest to find the sword. He traveled far and wide, but he could not find the lake where the sword was said to be hidden.

Finally, Arthur came to a small village on the outskirts of Camelot. There, he met an old woman who told him that the lake where the sword was hidden was nearby.

The old woman told Arthur that he must take a boat to the lake and then dive into the water to find the sword. She warned Arthur that the lake was guarded by a powerful monster, and that he must be careful.

Arthur thanked the old woman and set out for the lake. When he arrived, he saw that the lake was dark and eerie. He could see the outline of a monster lurking in the depths of the lake.

Arthur took a deep breath and dove into the water. He swam down to the bottom of the lake, where he saw the sword lying on a rock.

Arthur grabbed the sword and pulled it from the rock. As soon as he did, the monster emerged from the depths of the lake and attacked him.

Arthur fought the monster with all his strength, but he was no match for the creature. Just when it looked like Arthur was about to be defeated, the old woman appeared and helped him defeat the monster.

Arthur was grateful to the old woman for her help. He thanked her and then set out for Camelot with the sword.

When Arthur arrived in Camelot, he was hailed as a hero. He was crowned king of Camelot and the people celebrated his victory.

Arthur was a brave and just king, and his kingdom prospered under his rule. He ruled Camelot for many years, and the people were happy and prosperous.

But then, one day, a dark cloud appeared in the sky and a terrible storm raged across the land. The people of Camelot were afraid, but Arthur was not.

Arthur knew that the storm was a sign of something bad to come. He gathered his knights and they set out to find the source of the storm.

Once upon a time, there was a young prince named Arthur who lived in a kingdom called Camelot. Arthur was the son of King Uther Pendragon and Lady Igraine. After his father's death, Arthur was crowned king of Camelot.

Arthur was a brave and just king, and his kingdom prospered under his rule. However, there was one thing that Arthur desired above all else: the legendary sword Excalibur.

One day, Arthur heard a story about a magical sword that was hidden in a lake. The sword was said to be so powerful that it could only be drawn by the true king of Camelot.

Arthur set out on a quest to find the sword. He traveled far and wide, but he could not find the lake where the sword was said to be hidden.

Finally, Arthur came to a small village on the outskirts of Camelot. There, he met an old woman who told him that the lake where the sword was hidden was nearby.

The old woman told Arthur that he must take a boat to the lake and then dive into the water to find the sword. She warned Arthur that the lake was guarded by a powerful monster, and that he must be careful.

Arthur thanked the old woman and set out for the lake. When he arrived, he saw that the lake was dark and eerie. He could see the outline of a monster lurking in the depths of the lake.

Arthur took a deep breath and dove into the water. He swam down to the bottom of the lake, where he saw the sword lying on a rock.

Arthur grabbed the sword and pulled it from the rock. As soon as he did, the monster emerged from the depths of the lake and attacked him.

Arthur fought the monster with all his strength, but he was no match for the creature. Just when it looked like Arthur was about to be defeated, the old woman appeared and helped him defeat the monster.

Arthur was grateful to the old woman for her help. He thanked her and then set out for Camelot with the sword.

Once upon a time, there was a young prince named Arthur who lived in a kingdom called Camelot. Arthur was the son of King Uther Pendragon and Lady Igraine. After his father's death, Arthur was crowned king of Camelot.

Arthur was a brave and just king, and his kingdom prospered under his rule. However, there was one thing that Arthur desired above all else: the legendary sword Excalibur.

One day, Arthur heard a story about a magical sword that was hidden in a lake. The sword was said to be so powerful that it could only be drawn by the true king of Camelot.

Arthur set out on a quest to find the sword. He traveled far and wide, but he could not find the lake where the sword was said to be hidden.

Finally, Arthur came to a small village on the outskirts of Camelot. There, he met an old woman who told him that the lake where the sword was hidden was nearby.

The old woman told Arthur that he must take a boat to the lake and then dive into the water to find the sword. She warned Arthur that the lake was guarded by a powerful monster, and that he must be careful.

Arthur thanked the old woman and set out for the lake. When he arrived, he saw that the lake was dark and eerie. He could see the outline of a monster lurking in the depths of the lake.

Arthur took a deep breath and dove into the water. He swam down to the bottom of the lake, where he saw the sword lying on a rock.

Arthur grabbed the sword and pulled it from the rock. As soon as he did, the monster emerged from the depths of the lake and attacked him.

Arthur fought the monster with all his strength, but he was no match for the creature. Just when it looked like Arthur was about to be defeated, the old woman appeared and helped him defeat the monster.

Arthur was grateful to the old woman for her help. He thanked her and then set out for Camelot with the sword.

Once upon a time, there was a young prince named Arthur who lived in a kingdom called Camelot. Arthur was the son of King Uther Pendragon and Lady Igraine. After his father's death, Arthur was crowned king of Camelot.

Arthur was a brave and just king, and his kingdom prospered under his rule. However, there was one thing that Arthur desired above all else: the legendary sword Excalibur.

One day, Arthur heard a story about a magical sword that was hidden in a lake. The sword was said to be so powerful that it could only be drawn by the true king of Camelot.

Arthur set out on a quest to find the sword. He traveled far and wide, but he could not find the lake where the sword was said to be hidden.

Finally, Arthur came to a small village on the outskirts of Camelot. There, he met an old woman who told him that the lake where the sword was hidden was nearby.

The old woman told Arthur that he must take a boat to the lake and then dive into the water to find the sword. She warned Arthur that the lake was guarded by a powerful monster, and that he must be careful.

Arthur thanked the old woman and set out for the lake. When he arrived, he saw that the lake was dark and eerie. He could see the outline of a monster lurking in the depths of the lake.

Arthur took a deep breath and dove into the water. He swam down to the bottom of the lake, where he saw the sword lying on a rock.

Arthur grabbed the sword and pulled it from the rock. As soon as he did, the monster emerged from the depths of the lake and attacked him.

Arthur fought the monster with all his strength, but he was no match for the creature. Just when it looked like Arthur was about to be defeated, the old woman appeared and helped him defeat the monster.

Arthur was grateful to the old woman for her help. He thanked her and then set out for Camelot with the sword.

Once upon a time, there was a young prince named Arthur who lived in a kingdom called Camelot. Arthur was the son of King Uther Pendragon and Lady Igraine. After his father's death, Arthur was crowned king of Camelot.

Arthur was a brave and just king, and his kingdom prospered under his rule. However, there was one thing that Arthur desired above all else: the legendary sword Excalibur.

One day, Arthur heard a story about a magical sword that was hidden in a lake. The sword was said to be so powerful that it could only be drawn by the true king of Camelot.

Arthur set out on a quest to find the sword. He traveled far and wide, but he could not find the lake where the sword was said to be hidden.

Finally, Arthur came to a small village on the outskirts of Camelot. There, he met an old woman who told him that the lake where the sword was hidden was nearby.

The old woman told Arthur that he must take a boat to the lake and then dive into the water to find the sword. She warned Arthur that the lake was guarded by a powerful monster, and that he must be careful.

Arthur thanked the old woman and set out for the lake. When he arrived, he saw that the lake was dark and eerie. He could see the outline of a monster lurking in the depths of the lake.

Arthur took a deep breath and dove into the water. He swam down to the bottom of the lake, where he saw the sword lying on a rock.

Arthur grabbed the sword and pulled it from the rock. As soon as he did, the monster emerged from the depths of the lake and attacked him.

Arthur fought the monster with all his strength, but he was no match for the creature. Just when it looked like Arthur was about to be defeated, the old woman appeared and helped him defeat the monster.

Once upon a time, there was a young prince named Arthur who lived in a kingdom called Camelot. Arthur was the son of King Uther Pendragon and Lady Igraine. After his father's death, Arthur was crowned king of Camelot.

Arthur was a brave and just king, and his kingdom prospered under his rule. However, there was one thing that Arthur desired above all else: the legendary sword Excalibur.

One day, Arthur heard a story about a magical sword that was hidden in a lake. The sword was said to be so powerful that it could only be drawn by the true king of Camelot.

Arthur set out on a quest to find the sword. He traveled far and wide, but he could not find the lake where the sword was said to be hidden.

Finally, Arthur came to a small village on the outskirts of Camelot. There, he met an old woman who told him that the lake where the sword was hidden was nearby.

The old woman told Arthur that he must take a boat to the lake and then dive into the water to find the sword. She warned Arthur that the lake was guarded by a powerful monster, and that he must be careful.

Arthur thanked the old woman and set out for the lake. When he arrived, he saw that the lake was dark and eerie. He could see the outline of a monster lurking in the depths of the lake.

Arthur took a deep breath and dove into the water. He swam down to the bottom of the lake, where he saw the sword lying on a rock.

Arthur grabbed the sword and pulled it from the rock. As soon as he did, the monster emerged from the depths of the lake and attacked him.

Arthur fought the monster with all his strength, but he was no match for the creature. Just when it looked like Arthur was about to be defeated, the old woman appeared and helped him defeat the monster.

Arthur was grateful to the old woman for her help. He thanked her and then set out for Camelot with the sword.

Arthur set out on a quest to find the sword. He traveled far and wide, but he could not find the lake where the sword was said to be hidden.

Finally, Arthur came to a small village on the outskirts of Camelot. There, he met an old woman who told him that the lake where the sword was hidden was nearby.

The old woman told Arthur that he must take a boat to the lake and then dive into the water to find the sword. She warned Arthur that the lake was guarded by a powerful monster, and that he must be careful.

Arthur thanked the old woman and set out for the lake. When he arrived, he saw that the lake was dark and eerie. He could see the outline of a monster lurking in the depths of the lake.

Arthur took a deep breath and dove into the water. He swam down to the bottom of the lake, where he saw the sword lying on a rock.

Arthur grabbed the sword and pulled it from the rock. As soon as he did, the monster emerged from the depths of the lake and attacked him.

Arthur fought the monster with all his strength, but he was no match for the creature. Just when it looked like Arthur was about to be defeated, the old woman appeared and helped him defeat the monster.

Arthur was grateful to the old woman for her help. He thanked her and then set out for Camelot with the sword.

When Arthur arrived in Camelot, he was hailed as a hero. He was crowned king of Camelot and the people celebrated his victory.

Arthur was a brave and just king, and his kingdom prospered under his rule. He ruled Camelot for many years, and the people were happy and prosperous.

But then, one day, Arthur received a message from the wizard Merlin. Merlin told Arthur that he had been sent by the gods to warn him of a great danger that was coming.

Arthur was worried, but he knew that he must face this danger. He gathered his knights and they set out to find the source of the danger.

They traveled far and wide, but they could not find the source of the danger. Finally, they came to a small village on the outskirts of Camelot. There, they met an old woman who told them that the danger was coming from a dragon.

The dragon was called Smaug, and he was a powerful beast who lived in a mountain on the outskirts of Camelot. He was angry with Arthur because he had taken his magic sword, Excalibur.

Arthur and his knights set out to find Smaug and stop him from causing the danger. They traveled to his mountain and confronted him.

Smaug was angry and powerful, but Arthur and his knights were brave and determined. They fought Smaug and his magic, and they finally defeated him.

The danger stopped and the people of Camelot rejoiced. Arthur was hailed as a hero once again, and he ruled Camelot for many more years.

Once upon a time, there was a young prince named Arthur who lived in a kingdom called Camelot. Arthur was the son of King Uther Pendragon and Lady Igraine. After his father's death, Arthur was crowned king of Camelot.

Arthur was a brave and just king, and his kingdom prospered under his rule. However, there was one thing that Arthur desired above all else: the legendary sword Excalibur.

One day, Arthur heard a story about a magical sword that was hidden in a lake. The sword was said to be so powerful that it could only be drawn by the true king of Camelot.

Arthur set out on a quest to find the sword. He traveled far and wide, but he could not find the lake where the sword was said to be hidden.

Finally, Arthur came to a small village on the outskirts of Camelot. There, he met an old woman who told him that the lake where the sword was hidden was nearby.

The old woman told Arthur that he must take a boat to the lake and then dive into the water to find the sword. She warned Arthur that the lake was guarded by a powerful monster, and that he must be careful.

Arthur thanked the old woman and set out for the lake. When he arrived, he saw that the lake was dark and eerie. He could see the outline of a monster lurking in the depths of the lake.

Arthur took a deep breath and dove into the water. He swam down to the bottom of the lake, where he saw the sword lying on a rock.

Arthur grabbed the sword and pulled it from the rock. As soon as he did, the monster emerged from the depths of the lake and attacked him.

Arthur fought the monster with all his strength, but he was no match for the creature. Just when it looked like Arthur was about to be defeated, the old woman appeared and helped him defeat the monster.

Arthur was grateful to the old woman for her help. He thanked her and then set out for Camelot with the sword.

Arthur set out on a quest to find the sword. He traveled far and wide, but he could not find the lake where the sword was said to be hidden.

Finally, Arthur came to a small village on the outskirts of Camelot. There, he met an old woman who told him that the lake where the sword was hidden was nearby.

The old woman told Arthur that he must take a boat to the lake and then dive into the water to find the sword. She warned Arthur that the lake was guarded by a powerful monster, and that he must be careful.

Arthur thanked the old woman and set out for the lake. When he arrived, he saw that the lake was dark and eerie. He could see the outline of a monster lurking in the depths of the lake.

Arthur took a deep breath and dove into the water. He swam down to the bottom of the lake, where he saw the sword lying on a rock.

Arthur grabbed the sword and pulled it from the rock. As soon as he did, the monster emerged from the depths of the lake and attacked him.

Arthur fought the monster with all his strength, but he was no match for the creature. Just when it looked like Arthur was about to be defeated, the old woman appeared and helped him defeat the monster.

Arthur thanked the old woman and set out for the lake. When he arrived, he saw that the lake was dark and eerie. He could see the outline of a monster lurking in the depths of the lake.
